metadata.title: CVE-2022-33981 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
drivers/block/floppy.c in the Linux kernel before 5.17.6 is vulnerable to adenial of service, because of a concurrency use-after-free flaw afterdeallocating raw_cmd in the raw_cmd_ioctl function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-33981` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-191-generic - 4.15.0-191.202~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-191-generic - 4.15.0-191.202~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-191-lowlatency - 4.15.0-191.202~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1139-aws - 4.15.0-1139.150~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1149-azure - 4.15.0-1149.164~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1134-gcp - 4.15.0-1134.150~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1104-oracle - 4.15.0-1104.115~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-191.202~16.04.1').
linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1139.150~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1149.164~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1134.150~16.04.2').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1104.115~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
